alert.note: Alert for Fayette (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 24 at 7:22AM CST until January 24 at 11:00PM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Austin/San Antonio TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Colorado River Above La Grange affecting Fayette County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Colorado River above La Grange. * WHEN...From this morning to late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 26.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding covers low areas of the flood plain with no significant damage. Lowest roads and bridges are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:01 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 25.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 19.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 26.0 feet late this morning. - Flood stage is 26.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Colorado River La Grange 26.0 25.4 Wed 7 am CST 17.5 10.9 7.1 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 730 PM CST.
